titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: This day was a replica of the preceding. More letters, still friendly.
The Mayor of Hereford writes very properly repudiating the agitation in the city & announcing that he & his municipal brethren had refused the use of the Town Hall to the agitators

Wilson, the artist who is designing & executing the processional cross for Lady Londonderry, arrived with it, and I kept him to dinner. Lady L. and her sister Lady Helmsley came to dinner, and were very pleasant. After dinner divers from the College came in, and we had some music.
